data.title: Dallon Weekes says the debut iDKHOW album is “all over the place”
data.meta_description: I DONT KNOW HOW BUT THEY FOUND ME vocalist Dallon Weekes just gave an update about the band’s debut album, and boy are we excited.  Weekes spoke with The Aquarian and informed fans that the demos are done and they are set to start work immediately on the record.  Read more: ‘It: Chapter Two’ Funko [&hellip;]
data.text:
I DONT KNOW HOW BUT THEY FOUND ME vocalist Dallon Weekes just gave an update about the band’s debut album, and boy are we excited.

Weekes spoke with The Aquarian and informed fans that the demos are done and they are set to start work immediately on the record.

Read more: ‘It: Chapter Two’ Funko Pop! collection officially revealed

Weekes also shared a little bit of information about what the album is going to sound like.

“There are a couple of tracks that were written at the same time as the EP. Genre-wise, the album will wander around a bit,” Weekes said. “There is one song, which I am really fond of, that was inspired by (nineteen-forties vocal group) The Ink Spots. I love them so much and I have for years.”

“So, I wrote a song using their formula. We are not concerned with sticking to genres. I just want to write and record music I want to listen to. The music is all over the place and yet cohesive,” he continued. We’ll just have to wait to hear it to know what he’s talking about.

iDKHOW will be in the U.K. next month for Reading & Leeds. They were announced alongside DaBaby, the Compozers and Hoodie Allen.

Over the three days, the 1975 will headline Friday, Aug. 23 in Reading and Saturday, Aug. 24 in Leeds. Foo Fighters will headline Leeds on Friday, Aug. 23 and Reading on Sunday, Aug. 25. Finally, Post Malone and twenty one pilots will share the headlining spot in Reading on Saturday, Aug. 24 and in Leeds on Sunday, Aug. 25.

You can check out the full list of artists, below!
